Class CcddButtonPanelHandler

java.lang.Object
CCDD.CcddButtonPanelHandler
public class CcddButtonPanelHandler extends Object
CFS Command and Data Dictionary button panel handling class

      protected void setButtonsEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enable/disable the button panel buttons
      Parameters:
      enable - True to enable the buttons; false to disable

    • setButtonWidth

      protected void setButtonWidth()
      Extract the button(s) from the supplied panel, then find the widest button calculated from the button's text and icon. Set the width of the panel containing the buttons based on the widest button

    • createButton

      protected static JButton createButton(String buttonText, String iconName, int key, String toolTip)
      Create a button
      Parameters:
      buttonText - Text to display on the button
      iconName - Icon file name
      key - Key mnemonic for the menu item
      toolTip - Tool tip text to display when the pointer hovers over this button; null to not display a tool tip
      Returns:
      Button created

    • setButtonMargins

      private static void setButtonMargins(JButton button)
      Change the button padding between the button's icon/text and the perimeter of the button
      Parameters:
      button - Button to adjust

    • createButtonPanel

      private JPanel createButtonPanel(CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType)
      Create the buttons and button listeners based on the option type provided
      Parameters:
      optionType - DialogOption type
      Returns:
      Reference to the JPanel containing the buttons

    • assembleWindowComponents

      protected JPanel assembleWindowComponents(JPanel btnPanel, JButton defaultBtn, JComponent upperComponent, CcddConstants.DialogOption optionType, Container contentPane, JRootPane rootPane)
      Create the window's button panel and combine with the upper components, set up keyboard focus management, and determine the window's exit button. If no button panel is provided then create the buttons and button listeners needed based on the option type
      Parameters:
      btnPanel - Panel containing the window's buttons; null if a defined option type is used
      defaultBtn - Reference to the JButton that is actuated if the Enter key is pressed; null to have no default button (unless btnPanel is null as well, in which case the first button is set as the default)
      upperComponent - Upper window components
      optionType - Dialog type: LOAD_OPTION, SAVE_OPTION, SEARCH_OPTION, READ_OPTION, PRINT_OPTION, CLOSE_OPTION, OK_OPTION, or OK_CANCEL_OPTION. Ignored if btnPanel isn't null
      contentPane - The content pane for the calling container
      rootPane - The root pane for the calling container
      Returns:
      JPanel containing the window's buttons
